description: French cyclostome, from Ancient Greek κύκλος (kúklos, “circle”) + στόμα (stóma, “mouth”).

entries.meaning: Any of various primitive jawless fish of the class Cyclostomata, such as the lamprey or hagfish.
examples: Except the cyclostomes, as the lampreys and sphagobranchiæ, which are not real fishes, as I shall show elsewhere.
